Over 180 espionage flights by U.S. 
    Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist warmongers have made over 180 espionage flights against the DPRK in September with the mobilization of different types of strategic and tactical reconnaissance planes, according to military sources.
 At around 08:05 on September 30 a South Korea-based U-2 high-altitude strategic reconnaissance plane flew above forward areas of the DPRK for a long time for the purpose of electronic reconnaissance on strategic targets.    
 Such flights of U-2S, RC-135S and E-3S totaled more than 30 in the month.

articles.content:
Rwandan President on relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- The international position of the DPRK is being enhanced by Kim Jong Il's army-based policy and energetic external activity. The Rwandan government is attaching great importance to the development of the relations with the DPRK and hoping that Korea will be reunified at an early date. Rwandan President Paul Kagame said this when receiving credentials from Kim Pong Gi, new DPRK Ambassador to Rwanda, on Sept. 23.
 He expressed thanks to President Kim Il Sung for helping the Rwandan people in the past and said he was pleased that Kim Jong Il was deeply interested in developing the ties with Rwanda.

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador hosts reception
articles.content:
Belize Prime Minister supports Korean people's struggle 
    Pyongyang, October 1 (KCNA) -- Belize Prime Minister said Musa expressed support to the korean people's struggle when pak tong chun, new dprk Ambassador to Belize, paid a courtesy call on him on Sept. 20.
 The prime minister said that the Belize government fully supports the DPRK government's efforts to realize peaceful reunification of the country and the Korean people's drive for defending the socialist principles and developing their system.
